ygData.subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
ygData.msgSnippet: Lunarpine nodded, he understood her emotions. She was confused. I wanted that pred to come back, it would ve made a fine meal. Alone and afraid, he sensed

Lunarpine nodded, he understood her emotions. She was confused.

"I wanted that pred to come back, it would've made a fine meal."
Alone and afraid, he sensed her need for a kindered spirit, but that 
wasn't him. He could help her survive, but he could'thelp her live. 
The wolf in him knew her need for others, the bot in him knew her 
need to be alone. He knew his talents, his strengths, his weaknesses. 
She needed to learn hers. If it was left up to him he'd learn them 
first.

"Tell you what, I'm going back to base, come back when you're ready. 
We'll talk more when you get back." The wolf started away, he turned 
back,"Oh by the way if you need anything my comms open, keep yours 
the same."

Lunarpine turned and headed back to base.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> "Yeah, well, my rare spark could have gotten you killed today if 
that 
> pred had some back." She looked at him."But thank you for the kind 
> words. But I don't think I'm going to make any difference in this 
> war. I'd just end up getting killed or someone else killed. You saw 
> me react when you had me in the forest. I forgot my spark, and you 
> had me pinned. It just proves that...that I'm not..." she couldn't 
> finish the sentance.  She felt the words get caught in her throat.
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > "A good spark is always the deciding factor in a war. There's 
> always 
> > soldiers, but a good spark is the rare thing. It takes years, 
> > centuries,maybe even milleniums to end a war, and it's always 
> > something with a good spark that ends it."-
> >
